6EoMA9PT8B2i:kH[(|),.text: texturePackLengths is a list of how many tiles each texture pack contains.texturePackIndexes is a list of the first costume number of each texture pack.

:~phnK)Vn!wAz@9w@Qqi.text: An easy way of generating a list of numbers 1-10.  If this were a serious, text programming language, the +1 would not be necessary because the first element in arrays is index 0!  This means that there will never be an item with the index of the length of the list (generally.  There are some odd situations where it could be possible but normally no.)

i~C@tPgPwmoM;~@kQl;I.text: Round block is here to fix bizarre logic issue where ([size] of [Tiles])returns 220.000000000000003instead of the correct 220

zPiH40Od]6;]{Wzmo@-+.text: The entire "does tile exist at ..." block was my first attempt at retrieving information about a specific location on the board.  I was kind of tired when I made it so I worked on it for about 30 minutes, going back and forth at least three times about how to do it.  When I was finally done and ready to use it somewhere, I realized that there was a much more efficient way (I think) of doing it, but I didn't want to delete it in case the more efficient way didn't work, so here it is.  I replaced it with the below code.EDIT:  The code is now missing, and I am not sure which piece of code was here.  Which is why we don't "clean up"!!
